awd_titl_txt: Interactive Materials Science and Engineering Lab Kit
awd_abstract_narration: This Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase I project                  will develop an interactive materials science/engineering                       laboratory kit for use in basic materials courses which are a                   feature of all engineering programs, particularly in Civil and                  Mechanical engineering.  The kit will include test bars                         fabricated from advanced polymeric composites which are an                      important group of new materials of increasing interest.                        Specifically, the kit will allow students to compare theoretical                strength and actual strength of these different high technology                 materials, and the ready-to-use test bars will help students                    better understand the strength characteristics of linear elastic                brittle materials such as ceramics.  The educational product of                 this project has a broad and sustainable market particularly                    because the product is consumed in use and repeat sales will be a               necessity.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships
